result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruth A. Rollins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruth A. Rollins

defendant.name: Rollins, Ruth A.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:27 a.m. Defendant Ruth A. Rollins in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Ruth A. Rollins in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf43 and 16cm86. In 16cf43 - waiver of extradition - waiver signed in Court. In 16cm86 - State moves to dismiss Counts 2 and 3-Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Burns/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Restitution - $571.89 (includes 10%)
Court Costs - $443.00
Appeal rights given.
State of Indiana will be notified of waiver and defendant will be turned over to State of Indiana.  Adj. 11:32 p.m.

11:38 a.m. Defendant Ruth A. Rollins in court in custody with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Jodie Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm86 and 16cf43. In 16cf43 - Defendant wishes to waive extradition - waiver free and voluntary. In 16cm86, Defendant states she has money to pay restitution - $519.90 plus 10% surcharge. Adj. 11:45 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Includes 16CM86 and 16CF43. No contact with Cheryl Hull - No entry upon or contact with Associated Bank premises.

1:38 p.m. Defendant Ruth A. Rollins in court, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm86 and 16cf43. In 16cm86, in receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will proceed on own,  Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $5,000 cash bond in both cases (one cash bond). In 16cf43, defendant will be provided with copy of Extradition Complaint, Court explains rights. Court refers defendant to public defender's office for representation. Bednar statement to bail. Review of extradition matter set for February 29, 2016 at 11:45 a.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 11:45 am.
